@480v:nnThe shorter runtime here is because it\'s from a PAL DVD, i.e. 25 fps instead of the 23.976 fps you get in an NTSC DVD. Usually, the production companies choose to speed up the original film from 24 fps to 25 fps when converting to PAL because it\'s literally impossible to do a good-looking conversion otherwise, while the NTSC DVDs are first slowed down ever so slightly from the original 24 fps to 23.976 fps and then applied a telecining process where they use frame doubling to go from 23.976 fps to 29.96 fps which is the native NTSC frame rate.nnAnyway, that explains why 99% of the time, PAL DVDs will have a duration that is 95.96% the runtime of their NTSC counterparts. They\'re not shorter, they just run a little faster. You won\'t notice it until you do a side-by-side comparison (which is actually pretty funny, because then you start to notice that everyone\'s voice is pitched higher in the PAL release ;) ).
Thanks by the way, I have never seen this before, looking forward to it :)
